title: Buffing Ruby Sightstone
body:
There've been a number of threads on the boards about how undesirable {{item:2045}} is, as the only benefit from an additional 800g investment is an increase in health. A number of solutions have been proposed, but they often run into the same problem:

**Riot does not want to make Ruby Sightstone too attractive to other laners, nor want supports to be forced to invest additional gold into it before they can purchase other items.**

I was thinking about the problem, and I think I've come up with a solution.

**new** *UNIQUE passive: Grants +20% CDR on active items.*

Many support items come with active abilities to help them help their team, and often I find myself having 3-4 active items to work with. This change would make {{item:2045}} more desirable and more satisfying to obtain late game, but not force supports into upgrading it early on. It also wouldn't be nearly as desirable on laners as they usually have 1-2 actives tops, and the passive wouldn't help them nearly as much as investing the 1600 gold of {{item:2045}} into damage items or tankier items.

This isn't intended. Ruby Sightstone use to have a use. Before warding limits were a thing, the sightstone let you have 4 charges but you could only have 2 wards from it on the map at one time and when you upgraded it you could place 3 at one time with 5 charges. There was an incentive on top of the minor health boost. Supports almost always rushed ruby because you had the extra effect of placing 3 wards at 1 time without having to purchase them. It was a big spike in vision control. Now that the regular sightstone isn't limited more to the normal ward limit there is no reason to get the Ruby sightstone. 

Ruby needs to be brought back in line with the vision shift that occurred. Sightstone was brought into line, but Ruby received no compensation to help it out. So what use to be a benefit in purchasing it was taken away and the cost was never reduced to compensate it for losing its benefit.

>Ruby Sightstone **used **to have a use.



things have changed, and i'm pretty sure they knew rubysighstione would be come unattractive and willingly let it happen, mostly because

>Supports almost always rushed ruby

Back then, you would have boots+gp/10+ruby as core on every support.
I Prferfer the current state, where i have another 800'free' gold to use on situational items. 
I'm not against makeing sightstone more attractive in generall, but it shouldn't be to focused on vision controll, as that would make it mandatory to rush again.
Some better stats, why not, cdr for item actives(includeing trinked?) as suggested by the OP? Fine with me.
Just nothing that causes a return to the must buy status it once had...

I'm not calling for a return to what was. I've been a support main since I started this game. I've seen every iteration of the role starting in season 3. 

The problem is that Ruby SS has to stay with vision. It can't have others stats without them being extremely weak or it goes to lanes where we don't need it showing up. This is the sole reason it  has to be geared towards vision only. 

Ruby SS was a must buy for supports before because it allowed us to do our job at an extremely low cost. My team always knew what was coming because i would have at least 5 wards on the map at all time. Personally i liked being able to do this. I didn't have a problem with it and the only people who did weren't support mains, but peopel who weren't happy getting stuck playing support. Ruby SS let us ward out and save tons of the money that we didn't get. 

There needs to be something that sets apart Ruby SS from normal SS. Personally I think it needs to have a Trinket-esque regen style where every 2 minutes you'd generate another ward. Something that doesn't make it lane appealing, but stick to what the sightstone is suppose to do. In this case it also isn't a rush at all.
Same here. The stats it gives really just aren't worth it at any other time imo.

From what I'm reading into it, it is to make the item more desirable to build to after you have acquired a couple of items to benefit the passive from. It would probably be worth it after upgrading your support item to max + Mikaels.

Yeah, it's kinda supposed to be a bit of both. Like most people in the thread have said, Ruby Sightstone just feels bad to upgrade, it's just going from your early game item to a marginally better item with no real benefit to you. Even if it is gold efficient, it feels like it's not worth it at all.

Cool. Thanks for the interesting thread, Saixos. Sounds like people are maybe wanting more of an interesting transformative element when upgrading Sightstone. From what I've read, players seem okay with upgrading it late in the game, but even then, it's mostly just because you can, and not that it feels good to do so.
When even Braum players don't buy Ruby Sightstone before they get full build, you realize how inattractive the item seems.

We'll need to get Xypherous into this discussion; he has a lot to say about RSS.

In particular, I can cite this Reddit comment he made: https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/3d60zo/idea_a_way_to_make_ruby_sightstone_more_desirable/ct23kle

The bottom line is, Ruby Sightstone is not meant to be purchased until nothing else remains, and Riot doesn't want the item to become desirable to any class other than Supports (particularly Junglers).

I've made plenty of suggestions in the past, from increasing both the HP and cost of RSS (Xypherous said it makes the item unaffordable to Supports in late-game), to having RSS be able to regenerate wards in the field (the above link is Xypherous' response to someone else making the same idea), having RSS give bonus mana regeneration (since Junglers don't want/need that stat), etc.

Sadly, I'm at the point where I'm wondering whether or not things might be better if Sightstone and RSS were just removed from the game and replaced completely by the Trinket system. Then Supports would have 800 gold they aren't required to spend early, and can finally get some diversity out of rushes.

The main reason that's been cited in the past for not 'buffing' Sightstone is that everyone would pick it up. I know I'm kinda opening a can of worms here, but what if Sighstone was integrated into the trinkets we have now? I'm not going to pretend I know what I'm talking about when it comes to balance and gameplay impacts of such a thing, however I can't help but wonder if we can't pair the two and give supports one of their item slots back.

They're already the same item, the reason supports don't go yellow trinket is because red trinket is too important and they can support their warding duties with sightstone. The only way to get them to go yellow trinket would be of there was an item with a red trinket active.

I agree completely, that's what I meant by the 'can of worms' thing. If you completely take it away, you need to have other items compensate for the loss of it. As noted elsewhere on this thread, there's a reason many high level support players go sightstone/sweeper.
I had a thread with this very suggestion. My conclusion was that in order to close that can of worms you'd need to remove vision wards from the shop.
Now there's a novel thought.  Something you can buy in the game that improves active CDR?  With all the things supports juggle in their item bar, it wouldn't be that bad of a thing to have.

Repertoir, I want you to think of it like Jayce.

When you guys made the changes and gave him 6 ranks per ability, you did it because it felt like a trap to put a point in your ultimate, and you would always level everything up before your ultimate, because the stat bonuses it gave you just weren't worth the upgrade.

It's the same with Ruby, once you have it, you don't ever upgrade it until EVERYTHING else you could possibly upgrade/buy is upgraded/bought. Then you FINALLY upgrade it, and even then, it feels like it's a waste of 800g that you just wish you could invest elsewhere.

I'd say it's a little bit of both.

A lot of support actives are really useful late-game when teamfights happen. Lower cooldowns would help *immensely,* while the current cooldowns are relatively fine while laning. Take {{item:3222}} for example. 180 seconds before you can remove another cc effect and slightly heal your carry. Won't be up much, but relatively useful in lane in that one case you can't save your adc under normal circumstances. It's an emergency active when your usual kit just isn't enough that one time. If you buy this baby, ruby sightstone would probably come soon to compliment it (since it'll be mid-game/late-game when you have enough gold to have those two, boots, and your income item).

However, the money-making actives are on the support items (see what I did there?). {{item:3069}} {{item:3401}} {{item:3092}}. 40-60 second cooldowns, up a lot during laning and the beginning of most teamfights. High utility, incredibly useful. Ruby sightstone would be tempting to build early, but just not worth it since the cooldowns are relatively low enough to warrant building other useful items. 

Tank supports, who don't always build as much item actives as AP supports (but definitely can!), would get a bang out of their buck when building {{item:3800}} {{item:3143}} when their main initiator has their's on cooldown. 

I feel like the intended outcome of this change would be making ruby sightstone a desirable mid to late-game orientated item, and almost nearly useless early (I don't think many laners would be tempted to rush this).

Bonus MS

Bonus HP

20% CDR onto {{item:3060}} {{item:3069}} {{item:3800}} {{item:3222}}  would let supports scale their power efficiently.

why not give ruby sightstone 10% cdr, then have it upgrade into some god tier ward item.  increase the hp more, maybe give it armor, keep the 10% cdr and give it some kind of vision oriented passive, or increase the ward limit to 4.  maybe increase gold generation by giving players more gold for destroying wards, IDK something that ties gold generation specifically to warding.  that would also give low elo people an actual reason to get wards and less to build "full damage soraka"  i feel like the 2 things a supp needs most is gold generation and vision, so why not tie the two together.
There should be an option to move ruby to the trinket space (deleting your trinket) but opening up another slot for an item.

Well the other commonly recomended change would be having more then one upgrade for sightstone, with stats fitting each of the primary support types.

Ruby: HP / armor for the tanky supports

Amethyst: Mana regen / CDR for your utility supports

Sapphire: AP / spell pen for the mage supports.

But they would have to make the stats good enough to make them actually good purchases for this to work.

The problem with the Amethyst one is that there are already a bunch of items a support wants that give CDR, especially utility supports. On top of that, most supports already have 5-10% CDR in their mastery pages. They'd likely just find themselves not even wanting that item.

Or maybe an active that gives a shorter duration Raptor buff? Maybe to make something more balanceable make it so that it isn't really true sight, but only reveals wards? However, in bronze-gold, no-one buys wards (Except maybe 2-3 the support buys before sightstone, and a handful of vision wards), and as such there are so many fewer wards to clear out that red trinket becomes less efficient than green trinket's abundance of wards.

Also, Lee Sin won't be able to cheese it horribly.
